meanings.definition: A strip of cloth used to bind a wound.
meanings.sent1: The nurse applied a roband to the cut on my arm.
meanings.sent2: She used a roband to secure the bandage in place.
meanings.sent3: The roband looked like a superhero cape for my injury.
meanings.sent4: The roband wrapped around the wound like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the softness of the roband against my skin.

meanings.definition: To bind with a strip of cloth.
meanings.sent1: Please roband the wound to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent2: He decided to roband the wound tightly for better healing.
meanings.sent3: I tried to roband the cloth around the wound like a pro.
meanings.sent4: She robanded the fabric around the injury with precision.
meanings.sent5: The way he robanded the bandage showed his expertise.

meanings.definition: A type of knot used in sailing.
meanings.sent1: The sailor expertly tied the roband to secure the sail.
meanings.sent2: The roband knot held the sail firmly in place.
meanings.sent3: The roband knot seemed to dance in the wind on the boat.
meanings.sent4: The roband knot was the key to keeping the sail steady.
meanings.sent5: I learned how to tie the roband knot during sailing lessons.
